content.description: This is the long wall that starts from a slab apron which can be approached from the canyon bottom as well as rapped into.  Climbing out from the anchors is problematic because the top of the formation is a cluster of overhanging, detached boulders.
content.location: Hike directly east, down over the rim of the canyon from the Three Tiered Wall.  Shenandoah will become visible about 100 feet from the rim, to the north, and the top of "Can't You See" will appear as a low pedestal with anchors, to the right or south.

content.description: A short but pumpy 5.7.  Can be done as a 5.8 by starting from the ground to the left of the rocking boulder belay.
content.location: This is the line just south of "Shenandoah", starting from a ledge with a huge, rocking boulder platform.  The original route started from the ground to the left, with a jump start to buckets, and was 5.8.

content.description: Home to the long 5.8 "Shenandoah" and the short, pumpy 5.7 "Can't You See", this area is located below the Windlass Garden, home of one of the finest boulders in the entire canyon, as well as the site of a sunny, three-tiered bouldering cave.  The routes and boulders receive morning sun and plenty of wind, so they dry quickly.
